page.title: 11The Ring at Little Haywood.
page.content: The Ring was formerly a ring of cottages built for the land workers of Shugborough Hall. They were built in the form of an octagon with a communal well, wash house, bake house and fuel store in the middle. There was an archway into the ring. It is thought that it was built as an experiment in rehousing and was said to be unique. The Ring was built to rehouse the villagers of Shugborough Village when Thomas Anson landscaped Shugborough Park. The cottages formed just one building. The cottages were pulled down about 20 years ago and new houses were built. They are all bungalows, but some of them have rooms in the loft. The Jubilee playing fields are behind the ring. The playing field was opened in the Queens Silver Jubilee (1977).
